content: the year is almost over so I'd like to take a minute to reflect on 2017 hey
guys welcome back to another episode of black magic crafts well not really an
episode per se this is just some bonus content because I wanted to take a
minute to discuss with you guys the past year and the upcoming year as it relates
to this channel and this community so first of all in the past year this silly
channel that I started just for shits and giggles to share my passion went
from being a little silly channel to a very legitimate channel I passed the
threshold of 20,000 subscribers and a million views this year which is crazy I
know that's not a lot in YouTube terms but for just a guy sharing his hobby
that's pretty incredible also this year this hobby and this channel has led to
me getting to meet and hang out with one of the people that inspired me to start
this channel when I first got into the Hobby and that was hankering fer nail
from rune hammer formerly drunk ins and Dragons because of our channels and this
community I was able to get a chance to not only hang out with him for a couple
days but to actually game with him in my gaming room which was really surreal
because he was a huge inspiration to me and one of the reasons that I even
started this channel so Hank thanks for everything you've done and thanks for
taking the trip out to middle-of-nowhere Canada to play some silly games it is a
memory that I will cherish for a long time so thanks for everything you do
this year also saw the formation of the tabletop crafters guild which is another
crazy cool thing where I've banded with guys that were inspirations to me
starting this channel and we are forging a new
future for this hobby in this community and I've already seen the result of that
you know in the past two months I've seen more new YouTube channels related
to the hobby start then I have in the past two years so cheers to all of you
starting new channels in 2018 I promise you the for tabletop crafters guild
guild masters as a whole are gonna do whatever we can to try to help and
nurture those small channels to bring them up to a higher level that's the
whole idea I'm also nearing the end of the year
where I set the goal to create and release a video every single Friday and
I've done that and let me tell you that has not been easy I know you can watch
these videos and be like yeah it's a 15 minute video of a guy building some
stuff and he just does a voice over no big deal the truth is that these videos
take a lot of work in time to do more than you probably realize every episode
takes anywhere from 6 to 12 hours to produce and film and edit and all that
other stuff plus all the other things related to running the channel like
doing the thumbnails and the community stuff and the interaction and all that
this means it takes a lot of time and with a full-time career and a family and
responsibilities it could be really hard to make those every week
responsibilities with the video but somehow I've managed to do that I'm not
gonna lie some of that is just because of my effort and initiative and a lot of
that is because of you guys and your support and the responsibility I feel I
have to deliver on that support another really kind of important thing that I
want to take a minute to touch on with this channel in this hobby is how it has
affected me on an emotional level and a mental health level level with you guys
for a minute and in the hopes that maybe this kind of
inspires and helps some of you going through the same thing I suffer greatly
from anxiety and depression that's pretty bad I'm sure a large number of my
viewers also suffer her these kind of crappy things it's it's modern life
everybody's depressed and anxious all the time I don't know it's bad but this
hobby and more so this channel and my interaction with you guys has helped me
in coping with those disorders in a monumental way yeah sure I see a doctor
take the right medication try to be healthy and all the other things that
you're supposed to do I do that but it's this hobby and this channel and you guys
that actually make my life bearable and help me cope with a crappy thing like
depression and anxiety so thank you for being there for me whether you realized
it or not it's in large part because of your positivity that I'm able to manage
my disorders it's kind of unreal actually when you have a channel on
YouTube that has a million views you should be overloaded with negativity
that's just the way YouTube and the internet works I mean have you seen
YouTube comment sections on most videos they're a horrible place however by the
grace of this community and its positivity like 99.9% of the comments
that I receive from you guys are positive and that helps a lot day to day
when I'm having a crappy day and I'm feeling really down I get a comment or a
message or a photo of something you've built inspired by my work and those
little things multiplied daily are what take a crappy day and make it bearable
and what make a bearable day and make it good so thank you so much for all of
that positive feedback it really really means a lot another huge thing this year
has been both the Amazon affiliate program and the patreon page both of
these things I started just with the intention of recuperating some of the
costs of doing this channel and paying for some of the supplies and they did
that but after a few months both of those things started to grow at a pretty
alarming rate thanks to you guys that use those links to do your shopping and
those of you generous enough to support on patreon I've been able to accomplish
a lot of stuff that I normally wouldn't have been able to do I was able to buy a
new camera by audio equipment buy a bunch of tools and stuff to test out
that I normally wouldn't have been able to justify paying for and when my
computer died on me I was able to buy a new computer to keep the channel
schedule going and that's crazy so thank you guys it's really amazing that these
programs have been able to help me out in such a large way because these videos
take so much time to produce that means that on my weekends offer my career I'm
taking a full day every Saturday for the past year to build record edit and do
these videos instead of relaxing instead of spending time with my family
I work every single Saturday for several hours on these videos and the funds made
from patreon and the Amazon affiliate program are the biggest reason that I
can justify doing that to myself and to my family
who is without me those days when it could be a family day they are very
important programs to the channel I know I say that in every video
but I don't think everybody really realizes just how important it is it's
not just about buying equipment it's about paying for the time that I invest
in this channel but more important than that is how it's affected my family in
the past couple months this is something I've never really wanted to talk about
in an episode because it's a little bit depressing but I think it's important
for you to know especially for my patreon supporters you need to know how
these funds have affected my family in the past couple months in a huge way a
little over a year ago my wife got incredibly ill really really sick and it
lasted months on end she was hospitalized for like a week we didn't
know what was going on it was a really scary time especially with a toddler and
a sick mom it was really terrifying after several months we finally found
out what was wrong and my wife was diagnosed with Crohn's disease and that
sucks I mean it could be a lot worse it could be a terminal illness there's a
lot worse diseases out there to get but Crohn's is no picnic let me tell you not
only is the disease really life-altering and difficult to deal with but the road
to recovery and treatment is a rocky one there are a lot of different treatments
out there and they don't all work for everybody so you got to spend months
trying one if it doesn't work that's months of illness and then try another
one and repeat repeat repeat repeat and my wife had tried a few things some
didn't work one did and then it stopped working and it has been an incredible
strain on my family both emotionally and just it's just been draining and hard to
make matters worse my wife could no longer work
because she had to leave her career a good career that she loves in order to
focus on getting well and focus on treatment now that's hard for a couple
reasons one because my wife has a very good career that she loves and on
emotional level that's really difficult for her but also it's difficult
financially now we're very fortunate I have a good dependable career she has a
good dependable career and even though she's had to leave work to go on long
term disability to deal with this illness she is covered in some capacity
but there has been a big financial hit to the family that could have been
devastating we could be in a very bad position where we may have had to choose
between her staying at work to make ends meet or leaving work to
focus on recovery and worrying about how the bills are gonna get paid luckily
with my career but also because of the extra funds that this channel generates
I was able to confidently encourage my wife to step away from her job for a
little while and focus on getting well because I knew that I had some extra
funds coming in from this channel so to my patreon supporters you might think
that you're throwing me a few bucks every month you know to help me pay for
paint you know Mod Podge or maybe some
equipment and you're doing that but you're doing a lot more you are making
sure that my family survives a difficult health crisis it's crazy this channel
has made it so that an illness and my wife leaving her career temporarily has
not destroyed my family we still had a normal Christmas
everything is fine and I don't how to properly express my gratitude for
that there's no way that I can say thank you that really does it justice I didn't
even really want to tell everyone about this because I don't want it to sound
like a pity party but I think it's important for you guys to know that the
support on patreon using those affiliate links even just watching the ads on the
channel are helping my family in a way that I can never truly express my
gratitude for but thank you now having said that let's move on from depressing
move on to exciting this current situation with my wife's illness should
in theory hopefully be a temporary situation so on the road to recovery
treatment works out she goes back to work the channel continues the support
continues and all of a sudden I'm not 100% reliant on those funds to weather a
storm and that leads me to my long-term goal with the channel and I'd like to
take a minute to tell you what that long-term goal is it is not only my
dream but it's my express goal to make Blackmagic craft a full-time operation I
know that's a little bit crazy turning a DND crafting channel into a
full-time job but I believe that it can be done it might take a year might take
to you it might take five but I believe with enough hard work and effort that I
can do it I don't just want to do it because I want to get out of a
soul-crushing career and a job and although I mean like that's part of it
like let's be real but there's so much that I want to do with this channel that
I simply can't because of lack of time one of the big
problems with putting out a video every week means that I have to make a video
that I can film fully in one session this means that it's been a while since
I've done a really big involved build I just I don't have the time for it and I
know a lot of you are itching to see some more elaborate projects on the
channel and they want to do it and I I need to do it but I don't have the time
to do it not only is this a problem for the channel but it's a problem for me as
a crafter I have not been able to build a lot of the stuff over the past year
that I really wanted to simply for a lack of time if by some miracle and
enough hard work I could turn this channel into a full-time career that
would mean that I could dedicate all my time and resources to it that would mean
I could do big elaborate detail builds covering all the techniques involved
that would mean instead of doing one video a week I can do several videos a
week I could have a tutorial video in one week I could have a TPK in the same
week I could have a review in the same week I could have live gameplay so many
of you have wanted to see me filming my games but that is not even in the realm
of possibility given the current time I have all of these are things that I
could do regularly if I could dedicate all my resources to the channel not only
that there's other things besides just videos that I want to do but can't right
now my Longboat video from way back was very
successful and very well received in the community because it involved a template
which was super useful and hundreds maybe thousands of people have built
that boat with that template I want to make more projects with templates for
you guys but those take a lot of extra time that I can't do right now I mean I
still find on I really want to do some of those in the
New Year even with my current amount of time but that's something I would like
to do regularly there's all sorts of things I would like to do regularly I
want to publish modules black magic craft adventures I want to do more dams
diary videos I want to do all sorts of things that I can't do right now given
the time half of this channel is talking about tools and supplies to make life
easier I'm reliant on the tools that are available but I have ideas for tools
that don't exist that I know would be game changers for myself and for the
community at large but I don't have time to develop these ideas and make them a
reality because I literally only have enough time to do the videos that I'm
already doing without any extras and that's killing me because I have so much
more that I would like to share with you guys just put that on the table that is
the goal of this channel long term I want to dedicate my life to this channel
and this community there's still a fair ways to go but I have set that goal as a
official goal on patreon if you look at the page there's certain milestone goals
for monthly support and what happens at those goals and I've officially set a
goal for quit my career and take a risk and go full-time with this channel so if
you want to help me get there you can do that on patreon if you don't want to
support the channel or can't support the channel financially that's cool I only
expect a small number of you guys to do it but there's other ways that you can
help me out that aren't financial you can tell as many people as possible
about my work in my videos you can share my videos comment on them like them all
that stuff to help build up the moment of this channel anything you can do to
help that would be awesome again I don't this video is it's kind of
turned into a little bit of a downer and a little bit of a sob story and a
there's no wasn't the idea the really big thing that I wanted to express with
this video is that 2017 saw massive growth for this channel and it achieved
things that I did not expect if you asked me a year ago if it would be a
realistic goal to make this channel a full-time job I would laugh and think
that's crazy and not even in the realm of possibility and well I'm still a far
way away from it it is very clearly in the realm of real-world possibility with
enough hard work and enough help from the community I think I can make it
happen and if not well all that hard work will still equate to a whole bunch
of awesome content for you guys and for the community and to end this video I
need to say thank you to all of the people that helped me get where I am
with this channel right now so again a huge thank you to Brandon hanker and
fernell for everything you do in this community for your constant inspiration
and for your support on my crazy journey and for you making the crazy journey
here thank you again a huge thank you to my
fellow guild masters DM Scotty Gareth at the dmg info bill why lock
thank you so much for everything that you guys have done in this community
thank you for paving the way for black magic craft to exist and for helping me
to succeed and thank you for believing in black magic craft and this community
at large in the formation of the tabletop crafters guild I am really
excited and looking forward to what we can do together as a team in 2018
speaking of the tabletop crafters guild I also want to send a big thank you to
all of the other moderators and a Minh's on the tabletop crafters Guild
Facebook group you guys are doing the hard work keeping an eye on things
keeping things running smoothly without any praise without any real reward just
because you want to make sure that the group is running smoothly so thank you
so much for dealing with all the BS that we admins deal with especially since you
have no obligation to do so so thank you guys of course thank you to all 16,000
plus of members of that group who are keeping this community fresh and vibrant
and exciting and for sharing your work and thank you to all of the new content
creators deciding to sit down in front of a camera and share their love for
this hobby and starting new channels that's fabulous guys it's not easy doing
this it really isn't it's really hard to sit down in on a global stage and show
your passion to the world I know it's not easy so thank you to all of you who
have taken that scary and exciting plunge this year again thanks for
everybody that has done their shopping through my Amazon affiliate program
thank you to all of my patreon supporters again I know I can't really
make a thank you that is good enough but I I really really thank you from the
bottom of my heart my family thanks you my wife thanks you it it's truly
wonderful all that you guys have done for me and some of you have been doing
it for a long time man I was taking a look at the list of patrons to get ready
for the giveaway for the tavern set and some of you guys have been with me for
like 11 months now and have not given up and continue to support so thank you
again and thank you to all the new people as well
big small donations at all it's all amazing and lastly I have to thank my
wife for going through such a hard time with an incredible amount of bravery
all the while it's going on letting me follow this passion and giving me the
time to make these videos every Saturday I work for several hours doing these
videos and my wife takes my little three-year-old daughter and goes out and
does something fun with her so that I can have the time and the space to film
and edit and Thank You Connie for doing that for me I wouldn't be able to do
this channel if I wasn't given that kind of time so thanks for being a single mom
on the weekends maybe one day this can be a full-time thing and I can have
weekends with you and the kid one day thumbi that'd be great anyways thank you
everybody who's watching my videos over the past year put comments hit like and
whatever I love you all and I wouldn't be here without you guys watching so
thank you drop me a comment below let me know what you'd like to see from this
channel in 2018 because I'm always open to your feedback
and I am here to serve you guys on that note New Year's is coming up I hope you
guys have a great New Year's and I am really excited to see what 2018 brings
for this channel and this community I love you all Cheers talk later
oh and Happy New Year
